page.title: 08Brisley Church
page.content: The church is named St Bartholomew's church and was built in approximately 1380-1430. It is in the highest point in Brisley and you can see the tower at a considerable distance from all directions. It is made from flint built with buttresses to make the walls stronger. Inside the church,on the walls are paintings which have faded and are faint to see,one is a painting of St Christopher. All kinds of services take place at the church like baptisms, weddings and there are services for anybody who wants to go to church on Sundays. The Rector(Rev. A. Sawyer) doesn't live in Brisley, he lives in Colkirk and he looks after the parishes of Whissonsett,Colkirk,Horningtoft and Brisley.
